name: Mom's Seafood Pasta Salad for a Crowd
author: NOLLEEZ
summary: My mother has been making this every summer since I was a child. It keeps well in the fridge and is an ideal accompaniment to hamburgers, hotdogs, ribs...anything BBQ.
ingredients: 1 (32 ounce) package dried small pasta shells
½ (16 ounce) bottle thousand island dressing
2 (5 ounce) cans water packed tuna, drained and flaked
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain
In a large bowl, toss together cooked pasta, celery and green onions
Mix in French dressing, thousand island dressing and mayonnaise
Cover and chill in the refrigerator at least 3 hours
